laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The hip pain had decreased to 6/10.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Conventional Radiographs of Hips and Pelvis
laboratory_examinations.findings: Osteopenia of the right proximal femur and acetabulum. No evidence of fracture or avascular necrosis.
Bone marrow edema of the right femoral head, neck, and intertrochanteric region.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: MRI followed-up indicating slight residual high-signal intensity in the right femoral head and acetabulum, marking a reduction of previous bone marrow edema.

laboratory_examinations.date: Approximately 13 weeks after the initial radiograph
laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal mineralization of the right femur and acetabulum.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Significantly increased degree of bone density in the proximal femur and acetabulum.
